thread.title: AGUANGA: Domestic disturbance leads to officer-involved shooting, standoff
thread.title_full: AGUANGA: Domestic disturbance leads to officer-involved shooting, standoff - Press Enterprise

author: ALI TADAYON
title: AGUANGA: Domestic disturbance leads to officer-involved shooting, standoff
text:
BY ALI TADAYON / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 9, 2015 Updated: 1:49 p.m. AGUANGA: Domestic disturbance leads to officer-involved shooting, standoff Print Photo Share Pin It More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Related article Â» A person barricaded themselves in a home in Aguaunga on Friday, Oct. 9, after being involved in an officer-involved shooting.
Riverside County Sheriff's deputies had barricaded the home in the 44000 block of Jacob Court at 1:45 p.m. Friday, said deputy Michael Vasquez. The SWAT team had also been called out to assist.
About 11 a.m., deputies shot at the person, Vasquez confirmed. The suspect's condition and details surrounding the circumstances of the shooting will be released as the story unfolds, Vasquez said.
The Sheriff's Department received reports of a "domestic disturbance" about 6 a.m. Friday in the 54000 block of Wildwood Drive in Idyllwild. While responding to the scene, deputies received information that led them to the 44000 block of Jacob Court in Aguanga.
This story is developing. Check back for more information.
